title: What’s another way to say “stand in stark contrast to”? - Quora

response.answer_text: If that is an order or instruction, “stand in stark contrast to,” means refute this, prove (that someone is) wrong, disprove, deny or contradict (an accusation), invalidate. Stand in contrast to the story published. Refute the story published.Stand in contrast to Mr. A. Prove that Mr. A. is wrong.Stand in contrast to his theory. Disprove his theory.Stand in contrast to his accusations. Deny or contradict his accusations.Stand in contrast to the order. Invalidate the order.

Stand in stark contrast to is a whole lot of words to say contrast. Before: His opinions stand in stark contrast to those of his constituents. After: His opinions contrast those of his constituents. If contrast isn’t already stark enough, you can throw in an adverb to make your point: After after: His opinions starkly contrast those of his constituents.
